revised_title: Spectroscopy of Molecular Ions: Sign of Spin-Orbit Coupling Constant
tldr: The authors analyze the spin-orbit splitting in orbitally degenerate systems and explain how certain ions can violate Hund's third rule. They consider the spin-orbit coupling matrix elements within the shell and use a basis of symmetry-adapted components. The study provides insights into the behavior of molecular ions and the limitations of applying Hund's rules to polyatomic molecules.
